cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 195 miles SW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward Florida’s Big Bend; then forecast to bend northeast and track near or along the Georgia and South Carolina coasts before emerging into the Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (between Aucilla River and Cedar Key)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the St. Mary’s River GA/FL border northward to Edisto Beach SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet FL northward to Surf City NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend through the entire Georgia coast and into South Carolina and North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds (39–57 mph) are very likely; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out as the center tracks nearby.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground possible along the Georgia coast, including Brunswick river estuary.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher amounts; risk of flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous surf/rip currents Wednesday into Thursday.
